attributes.action: Make Vertebral Body Tethering (VBT) available on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
VBT has advanced much more quickly in Germany and the USA. Recent developments include the procedure receiving approval by the FDA in America https://www.mddionline.com/fda-approval-sets-stage-helping-thousands-kids-scoliosis and acknowledgement by the British Scoliosis Society as a potential future treatment here in the UK
http://www.bsrf.co.uk/bsrf-research/vertebral-body-tethering-position-statement.
attributes.background:
Currently in the UK the recognised NHS treatment for patients with severe scoliosis is a major operation known as spinal fusion. 

Vertebral Body Tethering is an innovative and ground-breaking alternative surgery, which is only available in the UK via private funding and the costs are substantial.
